about.description:
PySAL(Python Spatial Analysis Library) is written in Python intended to support the
development of high level applications.

name: pysal
raw_recipe:
{% set version = "2.1.0" %}

package:
  name: pysal
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/p/pysal/pysal-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 3c21c58ebca187f2c2d6b83b624739627a1201f6bc7b80d6f970762e76149911

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.6
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.6
    - scipy
    - pandas
    - seaborn
    - matplotlib
    - descartes
    - palettable
    - scikit-learn
    - geopandas
    - deprecated
    - rtree
    - tqdm
    - zstd

test:
  imports:
    - pysal

about:
  home: http://pysal.org
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Library of spatial analysis functions'
  description: |
    PySAL(Python Spatial Analysis Library) is written in Python intended to support the
    development of high level applications.
  doc_url: http://pysal.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html
  doc_source_url: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst
  dev_url: https://github.com/pysal

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - sjsrey
    - ocefpaf
    - mariusvniekerk

about.description:
PySAL(Python Spatial Analysis Library) is written in Python intended to support the
development of high level applications.
